summary: This appears to be a brief internal memo or note from an Associate Warden at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, referencing a discrepancy between received information and what they were told happened. The document is dated July 23, 2019, shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.role: Associate Warden at Metropolitan Correctional Center
persons.context: Author of the memo, located at 150 Park Row, New York. They are noting a discrepancy in information received.

persons.name: Captain Metropolitan Correctional Center
persons.context: Recipient or subject of the memo, also located at 150 Park Row, New York. The memo is addressed to or references this Captain.

connections.description: Both are staff members at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, with the Associate Warden communicating with the Captain.

events.title: Memo Regarding Information Discrepancy
events.description: An Associate Warden at MCC New York writes a memo noting that the information they received is not what they were told happened.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is dated July 23, 2019, which is shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
An Associate Warden at MCC New York notes a discrepancy between received information and what they were told happened.
The memo is internal correspondence within the Metropolitan Correctional Center staff.
The document suggests potential issues with information flow or reporting within the correctional facility around the time of Epstein's incarceration.
